If you're looking to create a course on how to manage frizzy hair, here are some useful tips and information you can include:

Devices:

1. Tangle Teezer Brush: This unique, ergonomic palm-shaped comb fits perfectly in your hand, allowing for better grip when brushing frizzy hair. [[2](https://www.stylecraze.com/articles/best-brushes-for-frizzy-hair/)]
2. Blow Dryer Diffuser: This tool is especially helpful for curly hair as it helps to define curls and reduce frizz. Place the diffuser nozzle on your hair dryer before switching it on, using a medium heat setting. Start on the top of your head and work in sections as you focus the diffuser around. [[4](https://www.allthingshair.com/en-us/hair-products/hair-dryer/mastering-blow-dryer-diffuser/)]
3. RevAir Reverse Dryer: This innovative reverse hair dryer dries, stretches, and straightens hair with its aerodynamically designed wand. Suitable for all hair types and textures. [[7](https://www.byrdie.com/revair-reverse-air-dryer-5270949)]
4. Ionic Blow Dryer Brush: This tool has built-in ionic technology that releases negative ions to improve hair condition, reduce frizz and static, and make hair smoother and shinier. [[9](https://soundersu23.com/best-blow-dryer-brush-for-frizzy-hair/)]

Products:

1. Ethique Frizz Wrangler Shampoo Bar: Perfect for very frizzy or dry hair, this pH balanced shampoo bar is safe for colored hair and full of natural goodness like Samoan coconut oil and cocoa butter. [[1](https://www.hollandandbarrett.com/the-health-hub/natural-beauty/haircare/how-to-stop-frizzy-hair/)]
2. Jason Organic Sea Kelp Conditioner: This conditioner helps to keep hair silky-smooth, and it's organic and free from harsh chemicals. [[1](https://www.hollandandbarrett.com/the-health-hub/natural-beauty/haircare/how-to-stop-frizzy-hair/)]
3. Babassu Oil Treatment: Using sustainably sourced babassu oil, this treatment helps prevent frizz and provides hydration, making it an effective one-two punch against heat damage and humidity. [[5](https://www.allure.com/gallery/best-blowout-cream-sprays)]
4. Hair Texturizer Spray: Suitable for all hair types and textures, this spray helps to create a desired look with ease, adding volume to the roots or more texture to the ends. [[8](https://www.brostrick.com/guide/best-hair-texturizers/)]
5. Heat Protectant Spray, Oil, or Cream: Applying a heat protectant product can repair damage caused by color and heat styling, leaving hair looking less frizzy and more shiny. It works on both natural and color-treated hair. [[10](https://www.byrdie.com/best-heat-protectants-for-hair-4588775)]

Blow Dryer Techniques:

1. Air Drying: This is the best way to prevent heat damage, as shampooing often strips natural oils from strands, leaving them vulnerable to damage and breakage, and blow drying can further amplify that damage. Air drying takes longer but saves time and energy in the long run. [[3](https://www.stylecraze.com/articles/diffuser-vs-air-drying/)]
